bibl.title: Surgeon General's Office Report Card, January 16, 1903

div1.p: These endorsements from the Surgeon General's Office regard the audit of Walter Reed following his death and requests for Reed's photograph and service record. The endorsements are dated January 16, 1903 through October 12, 1903. [Courtesy of the National Archives and Records Administration]

div1.head: Surgeon General's Office Report Card, January 16, 1903
div1.p:
S Jan. 16, 1903
Col. Calvin De Witt, Asst. Surgeon
General, U. S. A., President, S.G.O.,
Army Med Museum, Washington,
Jan 15, 1903, forwards Proceedings
of a Board of Survey (in trip-
lecate) convened by orders dated
War Dept., S.G.O., Washington,
Dec. 2, 1902.
(3 Enclosures)

S.
1st Indorsement. Jan. 17, 1903.
Resp. ret. to Col. Calvin De Witt,
Asst. S.G., U. S. A., President, Board
of Survey, Army Med. Museum, Washing-
ton, D.C., with authority to drop
the missing articles mentioned
within from the returns of the
late Surg. Walter Reed, U. S. A., de-
ceased.

Invoices of the medical
property found to be on hand sh'd
be prepared and forwarded to 1st
Lt. James Carroll, Asst. Surg., U. S. A.
who has this day been directed to
receipt for the same.
R.M.O'R., S.G.
FC
send enclosures estimating offices

S. Jan. 17, 1903. 1st Lt. James Car-
roll, Asst. Surg. U. S. Army, Army Medi-
cal Museum, S.G.O., Wash. D.C. Sir:
I have to inform you that Col. Cal-
vin De Witt, Asst. Surgeon General,
U. S. Army, President Board of Survey,
has this day been instructed to in-
voice to you all medical property
found by the Board of Survey, and
for which Major Walter Reed, Sur-
geon, U. S. A., deceased, was account-
able. You are directed to receipt
to the Board for the property re-
ferred to and render returns for
the same to this Office, in accord-
ance with par. 136, Manual for the
Med. Dept. 1902.

R.M.O'R., S.G., U. S. A.
B.M.I.

S1 Jan. 30, 1903 Calvin De Witt,
Asst. Surg. Genl., Wash., D.C.,
Jan. 29 In compliance with
instructions contained
in above letter from S.G.
submits copy of Return of
Med. Property of Surgeon
Walter Reed with Invoice
to and receipt from Asst.
Write nothing below this line.
Write nothing above this line.
Surg. James Carroll, 2 enclos.
E.

T Feby 13, 1903.
Aud. War Dept, Wash,
D.C. Feby 12 asks if
Major Walter Reed, Sur-
geon, U. S. A. is charg-
ed as a debtor on books
S.G.O. to U. S. officer
died Nov. 23, 1902. B

T Feb. 14, 03 Not accountable
for medical property. S.G.
T

WAR DEPARTMENT,
SURGEON GENERAL'S OFFICE,
FEB 14 1903

Respectfully returned to the Auditor for the
War Department, with the information that the
above-named officer is not charged as a debtor
to the United States on the books of this office.
R.M.O'R.,

Surgeon General.
[unclear]

U June 18, 1903.
Frederic W. Speirs, Editor,
The Booklovers Magazine,
1323 Walnut Sr., Philadelphia,
June 17, 1903, asks where a
photograph of Dr. Walter
Reed may be procured.
N
1st Indorsement June 18, 1903.

Respectfully returned to Mr.
Frederic W. Speirs, Editor of The
Booklovers Magazine, 1323 Walnut St.,
Philadelphia, Pa., enclosing photograph
of the late Maj. Walter Reed, Surgeon,
U. S. A., as requested.

R.M.O'R, S.G. U. S. A.
FH

U1 June 20", 1903.
F. W. Speirs, Phila, Pa.
June 19". Thanks the S.
G. for the photograph
of the late Major Wal-
ter Reed, Surg. U. S. A.
B.

V Oct 10, 1903.
George Derby, 5 and 7 East 16th
St., New York, N.Y., Oct 9, 1903,
requests to be furnished with
the official record of Major
Walter Reed, late Surgeon U. S.
Army, for use in The National
Cyclopedia of American Biography.
(1 Enclos) N.
Write nothing below this line.
Write nothing above this line.

V. Oct. 12, 1903. Mr. George Der-
by, 5 and 7 East 16th St., New
York, N.Y. Sir: Replying to
your communication of the 9th
inst., I am directed by the S. G.
to send you the enclosed papers
relative to the official rec-
ord of Major Walter Reed, late
Surgeon, U. S. A.

M.W.I. Maj., Surg. U. S. A.
W.
